Scheduling_WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Scheduling_WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Scheduling_WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Scheduling_Settings_Override_Data.description: The Worker who will be assigned Scheduling Setting Overrides.
Date when the scheduling setting overrides become effective.

validation.validation: Worker is no longer active as of effective date.
Effective Date is prior to the worker's hire date.

Scheduling_Setting_Overrides_Data___Sche.description: When set to true, this flag will enable the user to override the Consistency penalty weight for the Worker.
The value for the Consistency penalty weight.
When set to true, this flag will enable the user to override the Labor Cost Minimization penalty weight for the Worker.
The value for the Labor Cost Minimization penalty weight.
When set to true, this flag will enable the user to override the Preferred Weekly Hours penalty weight for the Worker.
The value for the Preferred Weekly Hours penalty weight.
When set to true, this flag will enable the user to override the Preferred Schedule Tags penalty weight for the Worker.
The value for the Preferred Schedule Tags penalty weight.
When set to true, this flag will enable the user to override the Preferred Work Times penalty weight for the Worker.
The value for the Preferred Work Times penalty weight.
When set to true, this flag will enable the user to override the Consistency Look Back Cycle penalty weight for the Worker.
The value for the Consistency Look Back Cycle penalty weight.

Scheduling_Settings_Override_Data.description: Data related to the Schedule Engine Settings to be processed.

validation.validation: Preferred Work Time represents a percentage between 0 and 100 inclusive.
To set a value for Preferred Work Times, Enable Preferred Work Times Override must be set to true.
To set a value for Consistency Look Back Cycle, set Enable Consistency Look Back Cycle Override to true.
Labor Cost Minimization represents a percentage between 1 and 100 inclusive.
Preferred Schedule Tags represents a percentage between 0 and 100 inclusive.
To set a value for Labor Cost Minimization, Enabled Labor Cost Minimization Overrides must be set to true.
Consistency represents a percentage between 0 and 100 inclusive.
Consistency Look Back Cycle represents a number of weeks, either 1 or 2.
To set a value for Preferred Schedule Tags, Enable Preferred Schedule Tags Overrides must be set to true.
To set a value for Preferred Weekly Hours, Enable Preferred Weekly Hours Overrides must be set to true.
Preferred Weekly Hours represents a percentage between 0 and 100 inclusive.
To set a value for Consistency, Enable Consistency Override must be set to true.

Minimum_Weekly_Hours_Validation_Data.description: When set to true, this Scheduling Validation will be enabled for the worker.
The value for minimum weekly hours allowed for the worker.

Scheduling_Validation_Working_Hours_Conf.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Minimum_Weekly_Hours_Validation_Data.description: The reference for additional hours configuration for minimum weekly hours.
Error Message related to the Minimum Weekly Hours Validation.
When set to true, the severity level will be Critical. When set to false, the severity level will be Warning.

Unique_IdentifierObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Unique_IdentifierObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Minimum_Weekly_Hours_Validation_Data.description: Validation Usage Type Reference related to the Minimum Weekly Hours Validation.

Scheduling_Setting_Overrides_Data____Sch.description: Data related to the Minimum Weekly Hours Validation.

validation.validation: The minimum weekly hours must be greater than 0 hours and no more than 168 hours.
To configure the Minimum Weekly Hours validation, Enable must be set to true.

Maximum_Weekly_Hours_Validation_Data.description: When set to true, this Scheduling Validation will be enabled for the worker.
The value for maximum weekly hours allowed for the worker.

validation.validation: The maximum weekly hours must be greater than or equal to the minimum weekly hours.

Scheduling_Validation_Working_Hours_Conf.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Maximum_Weekly_Hours_Validation_Data.description: The reference for additional hours configuration for maximum weekly hours.

When set to true, the severity level will be Critical. When set to false, the severity level will be Warning.

Unique_IdentifierObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Unique_IdentifierObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Maximum_Weekly_Hours_Validation_Data.description: Validation Usage Type Reference related to the Maximum Weekly Hours Validation.

Scheduling_Setting_Overrides_Data____Sch.description: Data related to the Maximum Weekly Hours Validation.

validation.validation: To configure the Maximum Weekly Hours validation, Enable must be set to true.
The maximum weekly hours must be greater than 0 hours and no more than 168 hours.

Minimum_Rest_Between_Shifts__Hours__Data.description: When set to true, this Scheduling Validation will be enabled for the worker.
The value for the minimum hours of rest between shifts required for a worker.
Error Message related to the Minimum Rest Between Shifts Validation.
When set to true, the severity level will be Critical. When set to false, the severity level will be Warning.

Minimum_Rest_Between_Shifts__Hours__Data.description: Validation Usage Type Reference related to the Minimum Rest Between Shifts Validation.

Scheduling_Setting_Overrides_Data____Sch.description: Data related to the Minimum Rest Between Shifts Validation.

validation.validation: The minimum rest between shifts must be greater than 0 hours and no more than 24 hours.
To configure the Minimum Rest Between Shifts validation, Enable must be set to true.

Scheduling_Settings_Override_Data.description: Data related to the Scheduling Validations to be processed.

description: Data related to the Scheduling Organization Settings Override to be processed.

validation.validation: The Effective Date must be unique for each worker.
